ygData.subject: Re: Archery training
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, Unfortunately, they didn t implement the archery skill until I was level 17. I didn t train the archery skill until I was 19th level.  I just put 14
ygData.messageBody:
Well,

Unfortunately, they didn't implement the archery skill until I was level 17.
I didn't train the archery skill until I was 19th level. I just put 14
practices into it and have been practicing it for a couple of days. I have
it to like 35th level....hehe. Very slow going. There are some good web
pages on archery that I will put at the bottom of this email. You are
correct, at this time we cannot utilize the tiny dagger or the pine needle
to practice the skill. However, it has been rumored we may get this ability
in a future patch, but this is only a rumor. I am going to keep at it and
develop it along with my other skills because I find that all of them come
in handy at one time or another. It is just going to take quite a few
arrows. I heard that a high level magician can summon arrows as well if you
have any magician friends who will do that for you. Best of luck training
your new skill! Here are some web pages on the subject:

http://everquest.gamestats.com/Skills/Archery.htm

http://www.voodooextreme.com/ask/editorial2.htm#jun-1

Grod
Paladin 19th Level
Innoruuk Server

-----Original Message-----
From: Gary Long [mailto:glong@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 1:30 PM
To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
Subject: [eqpaladin] Archery training


From: Gary Long <glong@...>

Hail fellow Paladins,

I was wondering how all of you were faring with archery skill advancement?
At
10th level, sinking 1 training point into archery, then using 20 arrows with
a
cheap hunting bow I have yet to see my skill increase. I purchased a tiny
dagger from a friendly enchanter, but found that I can't equip it. My next
thought is to either purchase a lot of arrows (100) and use the bow as much
as
possible or to "jump start" the archery skill by putting 5 more training
points
into it. Any feedback or opinions?

Kaladin, the 'range 50' Paladin
--
